intro: Malcolmia broussonetii var. bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored bluebell, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking blue and white flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun. Its foliage is hairy and often has a distinct, aromatic scent.
